channel.title: Bannock County|Idaho|United States on Roadsign Pictures
channel.description: Recent content in Bannock County|Idaho|United States on Roadsign Pictures

item.title: Pocatello Creek Road at I-15 North
item.description: Pocatello Creek Road at I-15 North. This type of sign assembly with the Freeway Entrance sign mounted on the shield is not very common in Idaho.

item.title: Pocatello Creek Road West at I-15
item.description: Pocatello Creek Road west at I-15. Use I-15 North for I-86, Twin Falls and Idaho Falls. Continue straight on Pocatello Creek Road for I-15 South and BL-15 to City Center.

item.title: I-15 North Exit 71 Offramp
item.description: I-15 North Exit 71 Offramp at BL-15/Pocatello Creek Road. Turn right for Pocatello Creek Road; left for I-15 and City Center.

item.title: I-15 North - Exits 69, 71, and 72
item.description: I-15 north at Exit 69 - Clark St/Center St. Approaching Exit 71 - Pocatello Creek Road, and Exit 72 - Junction I-86 West.

item.title: I-15 North - Exit 69
item.description: I-15 north approaching Exit 69 - Clark St./Idaho State University.

item.title: I-15 North - Exit 67
item.description: I-15 north at Exit 67 - BL-15/US-30/US-91/5th Ave. US-91 and US-30 leave I-15 northbound. This is the southern end of the Pocatello business loop.

item.title: I-15 North - Pocatello City Limit
item.description: Entering Pocatello on I-15 north. Pocatello is the 6rd largest city in Idaho according to the 2020 Census.

item.title: I-15 North - Exit 47
item.description: I-15 north at Exit 47 - US-30 East/Lava Hot Springs/Soda Springs/Montpelier. US-30 west joins I-15 and US-91 north to Pocatello.

item.title: I-15 North - Exit 44
item.description: I-15 north at Exit 44 - BL-15/McCammon

item.title: I-15 North - Exit 40
item.description: I-15 north approaching Exit 40 - Arimo.

item.title: US-91 North At I-15
item.description: US-91 north approaching I-15. I-15/US-91 north to Arimo and Pocatello. Continue over overpass for I-15 South to Salt Lake (Utah) and Hawkins Road. US-91 north joins I-15 north to Pocatello.

item.title: US-91 North at ID-40 West
item.description: US-91 north at ID-40 west to Malad. Continue north on US-91 for Arimo and Pocatello.

item.title: US-91 North Approaching ID-40 West
item.description: US-91 North approaching ID-40 West. Continue north on US-91 for I-15 North; use ID-40 west for I-15 south.

item.title: US-91 North at Oxford Highway
item.description: US-91 North at Oxford Highway in Bannock County. The intersection is located at Red Rock Pass which was the site of an ancient dam on prehistoric Lake Bonneville. The erosion of this dam created the catastrophic Bonneville Floods which affected much of the Snake River plain of Idaho.

item.title: US-91 North Approaching Oxford Highway
item.description: US-91 North approaching Oxford Highway south to Oxford and Dayton.

item.title: US-91 North - Bannock County
item.description: Entering Bannock County on US-91 north.

item.title: BL-15 North at Old US-91
item.description: BL-15 North at Old US-91 in Bannock County. Turn left on Old US-91 to continue north on BL-15 to McCammon and Lava Hot Springs.

item.title: BL-15 North - Distance Marker
item.description: Distance marker on BL-15 north. Distance to McCammon and Lava Hot Springs (via US-30).

item.title: BL-15 North - Bannock County
item.description: BL-15 (McCammon) North in Bannock County.

item.title: Jensen Road/BL-15 North at I-15/US-91 North (Exit 44)
item.description: Jensen Road/BL-15 North at I-15/US-91 North (Exit 44) in McCammon. Use I-15/US-91 North to Inkom and Salt Lake. Continue north on BL-15 for McCammon.

item.title: I-15/US-91 Exit 44 Onramp
item.description: I-15/US-91 Exit 44 offramp at BL-15/Jensen Road. Turn left for BL-15 North to McCammon; right for Jenson Road to Robin.

item.title: I-15 South - Exit 44
item.description: I-15 south approaching Exit 44 - Jensen Road.

item.title: E Center St. at I-15
item.description: E Center St. at I-15 in Pocatello. Use I-15 south for McCammon and Salt Lake (Utah). Use I-15 north for Blackfoot and Idaho Falls.

item.title: E Center St. at I-15 - Pocatello
item.description: E Center St. at I-15 in Pocatello. Merge right for I-15 South.

item.title: E Center St. Approaching I-15
item.description: E Center St. approaching I-15 (Exit 69) in Pocatello. Use right lane for I-15 South.

item.title: BL-15 South/US-91 South/US-30 East - Pocatello
item.description: BL-15 South/US-91 South/US-30 East (N 4th Ave) in Pocatello

item.title: US-30 East (Oak St.) at BL-15/US-91
item.description: US-30 East (Oak St.) at BL-15/US-91 (Yellowstone Ave.) Turn right for BL-15/US-91 South/US-30 East/McCammon/Salt Lake (Utah). Turn left for BL-15/US-91 North/Blackfoot/Idaho Falls.

item.title: US-30 East (Garrett Way) at Gould St. and N 3rd
item.description: US-30 East (Garrett Way) at Gould St. and N 3rd Ave. in Pocatello. Turn right for Gould St./Old Town; straight for N 3rd Ave. Turn left to continue east on US-30 to McCammon.

item.title: US-30 East at Main St.
item.description: US-30 East (Garrett Way) at Main St./Old Town (Pocatello). Continue on US-30 East to McCammon.

item.title: US-30 East - Pocatello
item.description: Entering Pocatello on US-30 East. Pocatello is the 5th largest city in Idaho according to the 2017 census estimate. Pocatello is also home to Idaho State University.

item.title: US-30 East - Bannock County
item.description: Entering Bannock County on US-30 east.

item.title: I-15 South - Exit 47
item.description: I-15 south at Exit 47 - US-30/McCammon/Soda Springs/Montpelier. US-30 eastbound leaves I-15 southbound here. This is the northern end of the McCammon business loop.

item.title: US-91 South at I-86
item.description: US-91 south at I-86 (Exit 61). Merge right for I-86 West to American Falls and Twin Falls. Use I-86 East/To I-15 for Idaho Falls and Salt Lake City (Utah). Continue south on US-91 for Pocatello.

item.title: Northgate Parkway West at I-15 South
item.description: Northgate Parkway West at I-15 South to Salt Lake City (Utah).

item.title: End BL-15 North at I-15 (Exit 71)
item.description: End BL-15 North at I-15 (Exit 71) in Pocatello. Use I-15 north for Blackfoot and Twin Falls. Continue straight for Pocatello Creek Road, Bench Road, and Olympus Drive.

item.title: I-15 South - Exit 71 Offramp
item.description: I-15 South - Exit 71 offramp at Pocatello Creek Road. Turn right for (Pocatello Creek Road) to (Pocatello) City Center and BL-15. Turn left for Pocatello Creek Road.

item.description: I-15 south approaching Exit 73 - Northgate Parkway.

item.title: I-15 South - Exit 73
item.description: I-15 south approaching Exit 73 - Northgate Parkway. This interchange opened in the fall of 2019.

item.title: I-15 South - Exit 72 and 71
item.description: I-15 south at Exit 72 - I-86 West/Twin Falls/Chubbuck. Approaching Exit 71 - BL-15/Pocatello. Continue south on I-15 for Salt Lake. The BL-15 shield on Exit 71 is incorrectly labeled as I-15.

item.title: I-15 South - Exit 72
item.description: I-15 south approaching Exit 72 - I-86 West/Chubbuck/Twin Falls. Continue south on I-15 for Pocatello and Salt Lake (Utah).

item.title: I-15 South - Exit 72
item.description: I-15 south approaching Exit 72 - I-86 West Junction.

item.title: US-91 South at I-86 East (To I-15)
item.description: US-91 south at I-86 (Exit 61) onramp. Turn left on I-86 for Idaho Falls, and Salt Lake City via I-15.

item.title: US-91 South at I-86 East (To I-15)
item.description: US-91 south at I-86 (Exit 61) onramp. Turn left on I-86 for Idaho Falls, and Salt Lake City via I-15.

item.title: I-86 West - Exit 61 Offramp at US-91
item.description: I-86 west at Exit 61 offramp, US-91 jct. Use US-91 north for Chubbuck. Use US-91 south for Pocatello.

item.title: I-86 West - Exit 61
item.description: I-86 west at Exit 61 - US-91/Chubbuck.

item.title: I-15 North - Exits 71 and 72
item.description: I-15 north at Exit 71 - Pocatello Creek Road. Approaching Exit 72 - I-86 West/Chubbuck/Twin Falls. Continue north on I-15 for Idaho Falls and Blackfoot.

item.title: US-30 West - Bannock County
item.description: Entering Bannock County on US-30 west.

item.title: I-86 West - Freeway Entrance
item.description: I-86 west onramp at Exit 61. The Freeway Entrance type sign assembly is not common in Idaho.

item.title: US-91 North at I-86
item.description: US-91 north at I-86 (Exit 61) onramp. Turn right on I-86 for Idaho Falls and Salt Lake. Continue over overpass for I-86 west to Twin Falls. US-91 continues north to Chubbuck.

item.title: US-91 South at I-86 East (To I-15)
item.description: US-91 south at I-86 east (To I-15). Use I-86 east for Idaho Falls and Salt Lake. Continue south on US-91 for Pocatello. I-86 east ends at I-15 just east of here.

item.title: I-86 West - Exit 61 Offramp at US-91
item.description: I-86 west at Exit 61 offramp, US-91 jct. Use US-91 north for Chubbuck. Use US-91 south for Pocatello. US-91 north is part of the Oregon/California Trail - Goodale Cutoff.

item.description: I-86 west at Exit 61 - US-91/Chubbuck.

item.title: I-86 West - Exit 61
item.description: I-86 West approaching Exit 61 - US-91/Chubbuck. This is the first exit westbound on I-86.

item.title: I-15 North at Exit 72
item.description: I-15 north at Exit 72 - I-86 West/Twin Falls/Chubbuck. Continue north on I-15 for Blackfoot and Idaho Falls. This is the last exit on I-15 north in the Pocatello area.

item.title: I-15 North - Exit 72
item.description: Approaching Exit 72 - I-86 west to Twin Falls and Chubbuck on I-15 north. Continue north on I-15 for Blackfoot and Idaho Falls.

item.title: Frontage Road North at I-15 North
item.description: Frontage Road north at I-15/US-30/US-91 (Exit 67) north. Use I-15 north for Pocatello. Use Frontage Road north for Pocatello. Use Frontage Road south for Portneuf Area and Mink Creek Recreation Area.

item.title: US-91/US-30/BL-15 North at US-30 West

item.title: US-91/US-30/BL-15 North at US-30 West

item.description: I-15 offramp at US-91/US-30/BL-15. US-91 and US-30 leave I-15 here. Turn left for Fort Hall Replica, Bannock County Museum, and Ross Park - Zoo.

item.title: US-91 - Red Rock Pass Historical Marker
item.description: Historical Marker on Red Rock Pass, US-91 South. All highways in Idaho have these historical markers. To see all of them check out the Idaho State Historical Marker Guide. Red Rock Pass is where ancient Lake Bonneville - an inland sea, which covered most of the great basin, overflowed into the Snake Plain. Evidence of this great flood is everywhere along the Snake and Columbia Rivers in the Pacific Northwest. This pass marks the divide between the Great Basin and the Snake/Columbia River drainages.
